body: Dear bee and bugs, I got some strange results when the **target building geometry** is not included as part of the **context geometry** for the **Sky View** simulation using the **View Analysis** component: There is no such problem when using the same workflow for Sky Exposure simulation. I assume the target building itself will be automatically included as part of the context geometry due to consideration of self-obstruction ... Hope you can kindly advise! Thank! -Ji target building is not connected to "context" input node: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/a4JBf1Z8ExbkXTOaBaLQ5b2eqmSBbj5yLxucq8C43Muua9VKh6AeaD70r4UaLelv8ncskAsdCjiYLWn6-Iz1SkBDsR-J7DRV/Image1.png) target building is connected to "context" input node: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/a4JBf1Z8ExZ2Hlyq4m1bHLu76fSgN4AZbxe0jO9Z1rsihhKAUmG77-WuZTkeBl4V86CfMT1p1OKuEzaXV-Rr9JfS7ar1mnZm/Image2.png)
topic: [clarified and updated] Sky View simulation results are strange when target building geometry is not included as part of the context

replies.body: Hi Ji, There is an input that lets you control the self-obstruction of your geometry. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/a4JBf1Z8ExZLed6op6K0-au633Rg*LWYFgD-K1Ug7b3oU4Cddby-crcf5MgDjPjE805aqDKwa5*xkqOqsEj3n0Uk-X0kC-1L/geometryBlocksView_FALSE.png) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/a4JBf1Z8ExZKTMoemiLxBWpr66aDjUbPN*GvBBUqj3aWC7aFiHl9LAAge2mEhCNfrWHjS93dCIvHY1r2pSGHxxioudReZazk/geometryBlocksView_TRUE.png) For more information, take a look at this short discussion: [geometryBlocksView_](http://www.grasshopper3d.com/group/ladybug/forum/topics/view-analysis-component-on-ladybug) Best Antonello

Thanks, Antonello, for the clarification!



But, isn't this option is set to "true" by default for view type 3 and 4?



Hope you can kindly advise.

- Ji

Hi Jin, you are right, we should modify a couple of code lines. Thanks [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/a4JBf1Z8ExauPsxwxlDr6pldq8uqM*xsrQHidyYGirrrUwEO8nrzkhOaqDDJV2ljYk55Bf8WjThfL8vE2bja57pwmX0pgMtr/_edit.png) Best Antonello

Thank you very much, Antonello!



It's really just about one line of handy code ...

Ji and Antonello,



Thank you very much for finding this bug.  I can't believe that I made a mistake as simple as putting a "<" when I should have put a ">".  So the component was actually doing the opposite of what I said it was in the description.



In any case, I have fixed this on the github now and in the attached file.

Thank you again!

-Chris

- Ji
